A mnemonic to tell stalactites and stalagmites apart:

StalagMites has an M = 2 ^ pointing upwards = how they grow, from the ground up
StalagTites has an T = the I hanging from the ceiling = how they grow, from the ceiling downwards

You really shouldn't be using the phrase, "getting smarter with us" in the closing of your episodes because "getting smarter" is synonymous with "becoming more intelligent." You are spreading information (rather well, in my opinion) but one's store of information is not a factor in the determination of one's intelligence, though it may commonly and erroneously be taken to be one. It is the underlying pool of factors, such as the ease of acquisition of new info, relating new info to old, being prepared to reject what is known in favour of well documented new info and on and on to a tedium ad anauseum (which I may already have accomplished).
Basically, a tape recorder can reproduce spoken information perfectly but one has yet to be accused of being intelligent. Though this screed could be continued and further refined for an unknown length of time, I resign this game and shall simply wish you a merry and prosperous day.

@1:08: "... both chemically AFFECTED..."
CAUSE AND EFFECT. Effected: brought about or achieved by (CAUSAL). AFFECT: influenced or changed. (EFFECTED BY CAUSE).

AFFECTED: an acted or performed CHARACTERISATION.
As in: She affected bliss, since his proposal was anticipated.
